001package io.github.ai4ci.output;
002
003import java.util.stream.Stream;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
008import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.CSVWriter;
009import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.Export;
010import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.Export.Stage;
011
012/**
013 * DebugParametersCSV represents debugging and parameter configuration data
014 * exported at simulation start.
015 *
016 * <p>
017 * Main purpose: capture key model parameters and derived diagnostics used for
018 * debugging and sensitivity analysis. Records are produced during the START
019 * stage and are exported per simulation execution to CSV files
020 * ({@code debug.csv}).
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * Downstream uses: consumed by diagnostic pipelines, regression tests and
024 * analysis notebooks that require a snapshot of the model parameters used to
025 * produce a particular simulation run.
026 *
027 * @author Rob Challen
028 */
029@Value.Immutable
030// @Data
031@Export(
032                stage = Stage.START,
033                value = "debug.csv",
034                size = 64,
035                selector = DebugParametersCSV.Selector.class,
036                writer = CSVWriter.class
037)
038public interface DebugParametersCSV extends CommonCSV.Execution {
039
040        /**
041         * Selector class implements Export.Selector to provide debug parameter
042         * extraction from Outbreak simulations. Transforms baseline configuration
043         * data into parameter records using CSVMapper for CSV serialization.
044         */
045        static class Selector implements Export.Selector {
046                @Override
047                public Stream<DebugParametersCSV> apply(Outbreak o) {
048                        return Stream.of(CSVMapper.INSTANCE.toCSV(o, o.getBaseline()));
049                }
050        }
051
052        /**
053         * Average contact degree derived from the baseline network configuration.
054         *
055         * @return the average number of contacts per agent used as a diagnostic for
056         *         network sparsity and mixing assumptions
057         */
058        double getAverageContactDegree();
059
060        /**
061         * The infectious duration assumed by the baseline.
062         *
063         * @return the infective duration in model time units used by the baseline
064         *         infectivity profile
065         */
066        int getInfectiveDuration();
067
068        /**
069         * Approximate bond percolation threshold for the configured contact network.
070         *
071         * @return the critical percolation probability used to understand epidemic
072         *         connectivity in the baseline network
073         */
074        double getPercolationThreshold();
075
076        /**
077         * Severity threshold used to determine fatal outcomes.
078         *
079         * @return the threshold value above which an infected person is considered
080         *         likely to have a fatal outcome
081         */
082        double getSeverityDeathCutoff();
083
084        /**
085         * Severity threshold used to determine hospitalisation.
086         *
087         * @return the threshold value above which an infected person is considered
088         *         likely to require hospital admission
089         */
090        double getSeverityHospitalisationCutoff();
091
092        /**
093         * Severity threshold used to determine symptomatic presentation.
094         *
095         * @return the threshold value above which an infected person is considered
096         *         symptomatic for the purposes of reporting and clinical progression
097         */
098        double getSeveritySymptomsCutoff();
099
100        /**
101         * The viral load transmissibility parameter.
102         *
103         * @return the transmissibility scaling applied to viral load when computing
104         *         perâ€‘contact transmission probability
105         */
106        double getViralLoadTransmissibilityParameter();
107}
